content: Hi folks--Have a look at the track page at https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2021-05+Clinical+Genomics! So far we've got one scenario focused on $find-subject-variants mentioned on yesterday's call, and I've added another scenario for exploring different uses of Grouper -- should be a good introductory scenario as it involves generating reports and navigating results coming from different types of tests. As always, feedback is welcome!

will 'derived from' and the other links be used to compare in querying with grouper? There's been some good questions on processing incoming reports. The 'derived from' and other reference links would still be used in organizing content with context, right?
(deleted)
Reminder for Kickoff/orientation for this track tomorrow, 2-3p ET - details in WHOVA

@Jamie Jones I've placed the FHIR Genomics Operations resources on a google drive. Description of the files, etc, is here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1kh0xtX0KrbobfFPO4d4rEJpbMqoB-RHCMggO95DnpCM/edit
Great, thanks!
oh, sorry @Jamie Jones forgot to mention that I revised the postman collection (to include more examples)

@Jamie Jones - my Whova setting on local time shows the Clinical Genomics Touchpoint at 12p ET (4-5p GMT) rather than 2-3p ET. Can you confirm?
Jamie Jones said:

Reminder for Kickoff/orientation for this track tomorrow, 2-3p ET - details in WHOVA

Today we have one at 12p ET, that's correct. There was a separate live kickoff/preview session back on May 06. The recording should be available in Whova, but we will dig into the scenarios today as well so no worries :)
@Patrick Werner Here is an article on SPDI: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7523648/

Duh...5 minutes after we had this discussion on preserving the FHIR Ids in examples, I figured out how to do this in the logica sandbox using Postman. PUT https://api.logicahealth.org/<sandbox id>/open/<FHIR resource of your example>/<the fhir id in your example>. :upside_down:
@Jamie Jones Hi Jamie, should we set up some time tomorrow to go over some of the Operations issues? (I
ve tried to summarize them on the google sheet)
Yes! I'll review and have a pass this afternoon checking the different logical cases

we fixed our genomic report viewer:
Here is the link to the MOLIT report viewer: https://molit.eu/genomics-reporting-viewer/
source code: https://github.com/molit-institute/genomics-reporting-viewer
some columns are not 100% compatible with the current IG
Will create a branch to fix these tomorrow.
You have to provide a FHIR Endpoint and a ID of a genomics report.
endpoint including resource type? or base url
left input: baseUrl of a FHIR Server, right input: id of the DiagnosticReport
Reminder for connectathon folks to add final items to the last 2 slides for the report out. Thanks all!
@Jamie Jones Thanks again for a very productive connectathon. I think you now have me convinced to move away from DiagnosticReport in Operations response :-)
